verses.verse: This is what<WH1697> Isaiah<WH3470> the son<WH1121> of Amoz<WH531> saw<WH2372> concerning Judah<WH3063> and Jerusalem.<WH3389>

It shall happen in the latter<WH319> days,<WH3117> that the mountain<WH2022> of Yahweh<WH3068>'s house<WH1004> shall be established<WH3559> on the top<WH7218> of the mountains,<WH2022> and shall be raised<WH5375> above the hills;<WH1389> and all nations<WH1471> shall flow to it.<WH5102>

Many<WH7227> peoples<WH5971> shall go<WH1980> and say,<WH559> "Come,<WH3212> let<WH5927>'s go up to the mountain<WH2022> of Yahweh,<WH3068> to the house<WH1004> of the God<WH430> of Jacob;<WH3290> and he will teach<WH3384> us of his ways,<WH1870> and we will walk<WH3212> in his paths.<WH734>" For out of Zion<WH6726> the law<WH8451> shall go forth,<WH3318> and the word<WH1697> of Yahweh<WH3068> from Jerusalem.<WH3389>

He will judge<WH8199> between the nations,<WH1471> and will decide<WH3198> concerning many<WH7227> peoples;<WH1471> and they shall beat<WH3807> their swords<WH2719> into plowshares,<WH855> and their spears<WH2595> into pruning hooks.<WH4211> Nation<WH1471> shall not lift up<WH5375> sword<WH2719> against nation,<WH1471> neither shall they learn<WH3925> war any more.<WH4421>
House<WH1004> of Jacob,<WH3290> come,<WH3212> and let us walk<WH3212> in the light<WH216> of Yahweh.<WH3068>

For you have forsaken<WH5203> your people,<WH5971> the house<WH1004> of Jacob,<WH3290> because they are filled<WH4390> from the east,<WH6924> with those who practice divination<WH6049> like the Philistines,<WH6430> and they clasp<WH5606> hands with the children<WH3206> of foreigners.<WH5237>

Their land<WH776> is full<WH4390> of silver<WH3701> and gold,<WH2091> neither is there any end<WH7097> of their treasures.<WH214> Their land<WH776> also is full<WH4390> of horses,<WH5483> neither is there any end<WH7097> of their chariots.<WH4818>
Their land<WH776> also is full<WH4390> of idols.<WH457> They worship<WH7812> the work<WH4639> of their own hands,<WH3027> that which their own fingers<WH676> have made.<WH6213>
Man<WH120> is brought low,<WH7817> and mankind<WH120> is humbled;<WH8213> therefore don't<WH5375> forgive them.
Enter<WH935> into the rock,<WH6697> and hide<WH2934> in the dust,<WH6083> from before<WH6440> the terror<WH6343> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and from the glory<WH1926> of his majesty.<WH1347>

The lofty<WH1365> looks<WH5869> of man<WH120> will be brought low,<WH8213> the haughtiness<WH7312> of men<WH582> will be bowed down,<WH7817> and Yahweh<WH3068> alone will be exalted<WH7682> in that day.<WH3117>
For there will be a day<WH3117> of Yahweh<WH3068> of Armies<WH6635> for all that is proud<WH1343> and haughty,<WH1343> and for all that is lifted up;<WH5375> and it shall be brought low:<WH8213>
For all the cedars<WH730> of Lebanon,<WH3844> that are high<WH7311> and lifted up,<WH5375> for all the oaks<WH437> of Bashan,<WH1316>
For all the high<WH7311> mountains,<WH2022> for all the hills<WH1389> that are lifted up,<WH5375>
For every lofty<WH1364> tower,<WH4026> for every fortified<WH1219> wall,<WH2346>
For all the ships<WH591> of Tarshish,<WH8659> and for all pleasant<WH2532> imagery.<WH7914>

The loftiness<WH1365> of man<WH120> shall be bowed down,<WH7817> and the haughtiness<WH7312> of men<WH582> shall be brought low;<WH8213> and Yahweh<WH3068> alone shall be exalted<WH7682> in that day.<WH3117>
The idols<WH457> shall utterly<WH3632> pass away.<WH2498>

Men shall go<WH935> into the caves<WH4631> of the rocks,<WH6697> and into the holes<WH4247> of the earth,<WH6083> from before<WH6440> the terror<WH6343> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and from the glory<WH1926> of his majesty,<WH1347> when he arises<WH6965> to shake the earth<WH776> mightily.<WH6206>

In that day,<WH3117> men<WH120> shall cast<WH7993> away their idols<WH457> of silver,<WH3701> and their idols<WH457> of gold,<WH2091> which have been made for themselves<WH6213> to worship,<WH7812> to the moles<WH2661> and to the bats;<WH5847>

To go<WH935> into the caverns<WH5585> of the rocks,<WH6697> and into the clefts<WH5366> of the ragged rocks,<WH5553> from before<WH6440> the terror<WH6343> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and from the glory<WH1926> of his majesty,<WH1347> when he arises<WH6965> to shake the earth<WH776> mightily.<WH6206>
Stop<WH2308> trusting in man,<WH120> whose breath<WH5397> is in his nostrils;<WH639> for of what account is he?<WH2803>
